lead_paragraph: MACY--Katharine (Kay) Hartman, died Thursday at home in Cold Spring Harbor, NY, two months before her 104th birthday. Kay was known for her gardens and her dried-flower arrangements, which she created for the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Tiffany and private clients. She lectured widely, and was profiled in The New York Times. The house that she and her late husband, Henry, bought in 1950 has long been the center of a loving family. There, for more than 60 years, they have hosted a neighborhood Fourth of July parade. Kay is survived by daughters Vicki, Florie, Christy and Mary, and grandchildren Ben and Laura Stickney, Macy Macaskill and Franklin Branch. A memorial service is planned for May 13. 1/3
